title: A Glimpse of the World’s Largest Aircraft Destroyed amid Russian Invasion of Ukraine
description: Recent commercial satellite imagery reveals significant damage to Antonov International Airport.

title: How the War in Ukraine May Impact Africa
description: The Africa Program outlines the political, economic, and security implications of the Russia-Ukraine war in sub-Saharan Africa.

title: Ukraine, the Middle East, and Hedging
description: Jon Alterman explores how Middle Eastern governments have responded to Russia's invasion and why their responses have been tepid.

title: What Does Russia’s War in Ukraine Mean for Latin America and the Caribbean?
description: Russia's behavior in its invasion of Ukraine illustrates the strategic threat posed by the survival and growth of authoritarian regimes throughout the Western Hemisphere.

title: The Evening: Russian Bombing, Realigning China Trade Policy, War/No More Trouble, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers Russian Bombing, Realigning China Trade Policy, War/No More Trouble, and More.

title: Ukraine, Coalition Building, and the Indo-Pacific
description: In the Ukrainian crisis, the United States has mustered, coordinated, and led a European and, indeed, a global response. Planning and coordination should begin now for a similar crisis in Asia.

title: Putin’s Invasion of Ukraine Makes Him More Vulnerable than Ever Before
description: Vladimir Putin’s central role in launching the war in Ukraine means that he will bear responsibility for plunging his country into a period of profound hardship.

title: A Europe-Russia Energy Divorce Begins
description: As Russia again invades Ukraine, Europe is taking unprecedented steps to reduce dependence on Russian energy.

title: Global Governance after Ukraine
description: The crisis in Ukraine signals a major shift in global governance, raising questions about transnational connectivity and the future of the international system.

title: Sanctions on Russia
description: The Scholl Chair explores the economic ramifications of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: Using Foreign Aid to Respond to Russia’s Invasion
description: Recognizing that Russia's plan to disrupt the current world order is focused on coercion and threats, the United States should offer a development alternative to maintain a free and whole Europe.

title: Economics Disrupted
description: The global economic outlook could darken further if Moscow retaliates with energy export restraints, cyberattacks, or seizure of Western assets in Russia.
